messages.title: Putting local people first
messages.content: The choice in the general election is whether you want a Labour Government or a Tory Government.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Create 25,000 new jobs in Scotland with more apprenticeships to learn a trade
Unlike the Tories, will keep your child tax credits and child trust funds helping take the pressure off hard-working families
Guarantees of a job or training for 18-24 year-olds out of work for six months, funded by the tax on bankers' bonuses
Keep the winter allowance, free TV licences and pensioners' free bus passes against SNP cuts to the allowance

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Halve the deficit in four years
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cutting waste, stopping your tax allowances for bankers and earning the most for those that can take it the most

mentions.candidate: The choice in the general election is whether you want a Labour Government or a Tory Government.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Keeps the winter allowance, free TV licences and pensioners' free bus passes against SNP cuts to the allowance

issues.economy: Get Scotland moving again with 25,000 new jobs ... Invest in young people ... Halve the deficit in four years.
issues.environment: John sits on the Energy and Climate Change Select Committee and campaigns to raise awareness of what causes climate change.
issues.socialWelfare: Unlike the Tories, will keep your child tax credits and child trust funds.

politicalExperience.achievements: The Government accepted John's amendment to the Welfare Reform Bill, which extended the entitlement to the higher mobility rate of Disability Living Allowance to blind people. John introduced a bill to create a legal right for anyone who becomes disabled or develops an impairment, to a period of rehabilitation leave and to have their employers make reasonable adjustments to enable them to continue working.

endorsements.endorsement: We have known John for many years, and he is a tireless fighter for our communities and constituency.
